reviewText:
I gave up on playing this game after it glitched out & refused to let me enter a building I'd previously been in & out of at least 5 times.

I have high hopes for this game, it seems interesting.  The version I played wasn't the final release, so hopefully the bugs will be ironed out in the final version.

The following are issues I had with it:

* Movement can be stitled, especially in the flashback scene
* The gardening scene in the flashback is ridiculously buggy, you have to wave your cursor up & down the rows of plants for ages until the interact hand pops up
* You're not told about quick time events until you're in the quick time event
* I couldn't find an 'exit game' menu, and had to exit the game through the task menu
*  The commentary track doesn't acknowledge when it's already playing, and will play two at once if you click on multiple items that trigger commentary tracks
* Invisible walls that don't make sense

reviewText:
I really hate to do this, but I'm writing a review despite not finishing it. It's not something I usually do, and I always say that a game should be finished before a review is written, but here I am. However, there is a good reason to why I did not finish this which I'll share with you guys.

So before getting into why I didn't finish it, I would like to talk about the actual game and what I've seen. The intro was good. It had good graphics, and had atmosphere building up. But that's it. It's too dark to see anything, heck I had to turn my brightness to maximum at times. The voice acting was really hard to understand, and there are no subtitles.

After that, I got up to the first soldier, and died. This is when I had to quit. The load option did not work, and when I tried to quit the game it gave me a bluescreen. I tried to fix the issues for atleast 10 minutes and then finally noticed to reboot my computer. The menu system is so buggy, you can not turn of fullscreen either.

Sorry for the short review. I really hate to do this, but I just cannot recommend it. I'm getting a refund.

reviewText:
Ok, so it's an Alpha... don't worry about the bugs.  I am sure they will be ironned out eventually.

But

This isn't really a game.  It's more like a book.  You don't have any control of anything you do.  The biggest challenge is walking through dark tunnels.  So dark that you could be staring at the ceiling and wouldn't even know.  There is no game here, and by looks of the direction the Alpha is going, I don't think this will ever be a game.  Seems more like a really long cinematic where everyone once in awhile you press a button to continue, blow a torch to continue, light a torch to continue.

But I purchased it like a dummy... I was tricked into buying a game that you walk around and do nothing.  I will be trying it out  time to time to see what else may unfold.

reviewText:
So I found this game when it was on desura is an alpha state (it was also in steam greenlight at that time). I thought it looked really cool so I picked it up for three dollars. At that point, it looked like NM was actually putting out content for this game, and were looking at feedback found on the forum (which was minimal). They put out one major update and added a little chapter, know by many as the laggy garden chapter. That was Aug 21 2012. Then a few months after that I got a messages from Dante asking me if would beta test Polarium, a new game they were working on. I thought it was odd they were not going to work on The Tower, but as I found out Polarium was going to be on Xbox live Arcade. I know that sometimes you have to take funding where you can get it. So I thought maybe after they finish Polarium and get more money they would finish The Tower. Well after testing and sending my feedback on Polarium, everything went quite for a while.

Then out of the blue I saw Dante has posted that there was a Kickstarter (or indigogo, I don't remember) for The Tower. Again I thought this was odd because I thought they would have more funding. I backed this though because I really like this project (granted this was a mistake on my end, not learning from the past). I was following the steam discussions on the game and NM was giving out keys for people to play test it. I said I would love to help (again me being a ♥♥♥♥♥). They sent me a key... and it did not work. So I posted that my key did not work. I didn't hear anything back and didn't see anything more posted from NM. It seemed the game was dead again.

With this whole Tower issue out of my mind, and me counting the game as a loss (which was a disappointment to me, and still is because the IDEA is great) I saw this private eye game on steam called Sam Glyph: Private Eye! (I'm a sucker for a detective Noir theme). At first Glance it looked interesting, so I scrolled down the page... then I saw it's developer was NM. I took a pass because from what I knew of them, and the posts in the comments it sounded like another unfinished game. I did happened to buy it when it was on sale for a dollar so later. I played it, and again, the idea is interesting, but I was correct, it is just another unfinished game.

Again I pushed NM out of my mind, and tried to forget them. Then one day I noticed that Dante had posted another crowdfunding project for The Tower (again I can't remember which one). I laughed and told myself I wanted to back this and help the project, but they lost my trust long ago, and it seemed like they were nowhere near reaching their goal. So I brushed this off and went on with my life. Then today I just happen to notice that The Tower was fully released on steam and I had it in my library. I played it, and it was different than the old game. New engine and voice acting and story. The idea seemed to be the game (which I still think is a good idea). The game looks ok and runs better than in the past. Though the game right now, just seems to be walk ten steps and have a dialog part where you do not feel engaged and feel bored about.

Sadly as Tryyton says in this review of the game, it seems NM is just trying to scam our money and I have been a sucker more times than I should have. Don't buy this game, don't buy any of NM games, they are just unfinished.

Also there is this... http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1094973/Musician-barred-selling-soul-eBay.html
(Also sharing this link in no way condones my support of the DailyMail)

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cSO-x9yauY8&list=UU7_-PLIhjsEBwIQXqKxmNpA

The Tower is an adventure action-horror game.  This is a low-budget
indie game that despite being funded on Kickstarter, and was on Early
Access, is selling on Steam with the addendum that any further
production has been halted due to lack of funding.  They state that
they will only add more to the game if they have enough sales.  What?!

The game runs poorly, and the sound is reminiscent of an early 2000
game.  The ambient sound overpowers the character narration and plot
details.  Bugs proliferate throughout, and the plot wanders in
pointless directions.  The horror aspect of the game is simply in
being unable to complete the tasks that you are asked to do.
It wastes your time, and lies to you.
I would rather hug a porcupine than recommend this game to anyone.

For more details, see the linked video review, as this is a basic summary of
what I cover in my video.

Thanks for your viewership and support for more videos check click here.

http://www.youtube.com/user/SocioPyscho

reviewText:
This game is based on an interesting and rather underexplored concept in video games; sound, and the potential mechanics involved in the proper usage of sound.

Unfortunately this game does not succeed in utilizing sound in the right ways. The idea is to use the sounds around you to navigate the darkness of this prison that you are trying to escape from. An interesting gameplay concept, but they didn't pull it off. Rather than using sounds to navigate the black corridors, I just blindly walk around until I find the right place to go. It's easier to do and takes less time.

Also, it's a little too obvious that this game is made in Unity. Some of the effects had little to no work done on them and don't add to the game but rather take away, which is also unfortunate.

All in all, I love the concept of using sound as a gameplay mechanic, but I don't think this game does that correctly.

5/10
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This thing came out of Early Access incomplete. Several times it has been stated it would be worked on again, etc.  At one point there was even an attempt to sell pre-alpha access to a 2015 updated version (they eventually just gave said access away supposedly).
Still no proper updates, the game is barely a few minutes long.
Game is still incomplete., Still very broken.
Here is a fun example, pausing multiple times during play, sometimes the mouse will stop responding and thus you'll be unable to exit the pause menu.  Workaround, hit ESC to close the menu (notice mouse movement still works) or if you actually need to do something on the menu, ALT+TAB out of the game, then back in, then use the mouse to select menu items.

There are many more examples of things broken in this game.

Then there are issues with presentation, such as the fact there are baked into your eyes apparently, lens flare, dirt, blood, and film grain.  These spots never change position or angle and are always in view as though a permanent part of your eyes.

The whole thing is a wonky broken mess.

reviewText: I'll start off by saying i'm 50-50 on this game because I love the mechanics and gameplay. So very different than alot of dungeon crawlers yet so very simplistic. I used a very high end headphone setup consisting of a $200+ tube amp, $100+ DAC, and $300+ headphones which makes this game shine greatly. During the dungeon sequences I just closed my eyes and listened to the sounds and when I found my way using the sounds the character even yelled out oh thank god light" or something to that effect which was delightful because I knew then to open my eyes and continue on with a lighted sequence of events.\n\nThat being said I'm pretty disappointed in how far or rather the lack of how far the developers have got with this game. According to the Steam page this has been a work in progress since 2012?! Really?! I'm not sure if this is a development team of one or two people
date: but really that would be a mute point as games like Space Engineers have grown leaps and bounds in the last year with a scant development team. The game has alot
hoursPlayed: of bugs still. I found myself stuck against a physics wall numerous times during the farm sequence that should not have been an issue; for instance when trying to head back to the crops to plant seeds or water if I came to close to the tree next to the crops I would hit said physics wall and would have to back up and take a more sceneic course.\n\nI really like the game and the what you're trying to do with it
voteText: but for now I'm going to have to go with a thumbs down for purchase at this time. The game is simply "not where it should be" for how long it has been in development. I'll continue to check in every 6 months or so and hope to right a better review then. As for some points on the other negative review
helpfulPercent: I found everything to be in place where I thought it should have been with a little bit of calculation
votesHelpful: I don't think thats a point of development need. More effort put towards the bugs

reviewText: I really wanted to give this game a chance, especially after all the bad reviews and then the big update on 15th Aug. The first few minutes looked and sounded fantastic with great atmosphere and sound effects. I thought I was on to a winner. Then I fell into a big black hole with almost no light, and it all went downhill from there (literally) I used the sounds of the cave and the falling water to guide myself around the blackened cave and got to a spot where there seemed to be the outline of a mouth of a tunnel, but I couldn't get my caracter to go into the tunnel. There are no jump,crouch or crawl keys, you just keep trying to walk into this opening but get nowhere fast. I logged around 32 minutes play time and about 25 minutes of that were spent just feeling my way around this damed cave.\nAnother problem for me is there's no key mapping options and I hate WASD, it comletely ruins a game when you can't set your own key layout.\nSuch a pity, it looked very promising. If the developer can sort these problems out then, I WILL BE BACK
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, this game has AMAZING potential and it is quite nice. However it is in Early Access Alpha so there are a lot of problems with it. Minus the bugs and the glitches, I am having quite some fun with this game.

Pros:

. Audio in the game is ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL, the sounds of water trickling from the top of the cave or the sound of stabbing a guard in the head... Amazing.
. Lack of sight makes you traverse the pitch black caverns entirely by sound, which is very fun and interesting.
. Very intriguing storyline right off the bat, instantly had me drawn in.
. Voice acting is pretty good.

Cons:

. A LOT of bugs and glitches. (As to be expected in a early access alpha.)
. While the voice acting is pretty good, there needs to be more emotion in the voices.
. Some of the script needs modifying, at times I just sat there thinking That sounds quite odd."
. Worst bug I have encountered is MANY invisible barriers in the flashback of your farm
date: there are a lot of invisible barriers that restrict you from entering the tool shed and other areas of your farm. This makes it unplayable for me.\n\nAll in all
recommended: with all the bugs and other issues of the game
hoursPlayed: for $5 you really can't go wrong. They have done quite well with this game so far and I am so eager to see more of it (after they fix the bugs that is)"
voteText: July 3, 2014

reviewText: The Tower... I truly don't know what I expected out of this one. I hopped into this game expecting the worse and got no less than what I expected leaving me with little to no attachment to this game. That said it seemed like a half decent idea for a horror game however completely flopped do to the neglect of the developer. This game really wasn't ready for release and should be tagged as an early access title. Leaving a lot to be desired gameplay wise this game shoves you into an unskippable seemingly 3 minute intro of you just hanging into a room before allowing you to move on your own volition on a set straight path with no branching alternatives. No problem there as it is only the first 10 minutes now the problems arises when you get to a man in a cage in a room where you can hardly see anything with a 1 hit kill guard lurking about. The mechanics leave no room for error whilst trying to evade this guard. (I found no way to). So this is essentially where the gameplay ended for me. You die and have to waste another 10-15 minutes meandering back to die again. And with the save function in a state of disrepair you are looking at a CHORE an absolute waste of your time and money. Take your 3 dollars elsewhere and buy up something worth your time. 3/10 The tower hath ♥♥♥♥ed up. If you would like to see some gameplay here is a link.\nhttps://youtu.be/GWPSVeUeNPw
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Even though there is only about 30 minutes of the game to play so far I have to say I enjoyed it. Not so much the actual gameplay (it's still extremely glitchy, but playable if you have the patience) but the story is interesting and you want to know why he was thrown in the tower and will he ever escape?

The voice-acting is excellent and the games audio is superb.  Trying to find your way in complete darkness using only your hearing is a welcoming and unique challenge.

The protagonist guides you through the game as if telling a story, and sometimes takes you back to the happier times" when he was a free man. (  Only one time in this early stage of the game but i guess we'll be visiting more of these "happier times" to maybe find out how he got in this prison to begin with  ) Where you get to fix things on his nice farm and stuff. (where the games glitches and bugs are most frustrating btw)

In these 30 minutes of the game there is only one "combatscene" and it was pitch black
date: you only  listen  to the fight (the grabbing of body parts
recommended: snapping of necks etc) as the protagonist explains the action; so you don't actually see the fight happen
hoursPlayed:
but the voiceacting and the atmosphere is so great (even in this early version of the game) that i didn't mind.

This game has as ton of potentiall but is currently too expensive for only 30 minutes of gameplay so buying the game now for 10 bucks is not worth it in my opinion. I suggest you buy it whenever the developers puts more content in or whenever the game is on sale.

+/-
+Story
+Atmosphere
+Sound / Audio
+Originality
+Potential

-Glitchy
-No way to return to the menu unless in a restingplace
-Not much gameplay at the moment"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hey guys,
So i'll try keep this concise and to the point. The tower is an early access game that blends story, adventure and horror all into one. Keeping in mind that it is of course an early access game i will point out that it lacks alot of playability and if you want a game that you can play until morning dawns then this is definately not for you. Im supprised they can release this when it has max 1 hour of game play and thats if u crawl everywhere. Overall i like where the game is going and i think it will really cature alot of horror and adventure seekers but atm i would recommend that you watch a video of someone playing it and save yourself $7. I give it a thumbs up only because i like the concept; On everything else its a thumbs down.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay. First off, I'd like to thank the team for building and continually adding to this game. It is much appreciated, from Developer to another.

Whilst I didn't play a very long time from time constraints, I would like to point out, that the only creepy" moments I had was the first hallway (because jumping into the unknown is scary) and every time after that
date: just the initial creepy effect of going from a lit room to a non-lit room.\n\nBut being in complete darkness with limited sound fx
hoursPlayed: and I'm sure I hit every wall in the dark room at least 6 times
voteText: was not fun. I was not creeped out
helpfulPercent: it had no atmosphere to give a creeped out feeling
votesHelpful: and it didn't feel like a "darkness of The Tower" so much as "The Annoying Bumping Into Walls and Pools of Water Tower".\n\nNow
votesFunny: the whole relative point is to run around until you find the torches
commentsCount: which are your save locations. Might I ask
column16: make the ESC key to bring up a menu to quit the game? I just had to quit now to go
column17: and I had to tab out to hurriedly quit. Sure

column19:
but it's not like I'll miss it anytime soon.

=====
Pros:
Beautiful graphics
Runs smooth
Great FPS
The torches are not cheaply made
Unity was a good choice


Cons:
The heat simmer from the torches is a little much. It might look like that if a jet fueled engine were next to it: sure
Bumping around in the dark... I guess its the point of the game
No Score/Music during the running around to give off a feeling of space and atmosphere


The Pros outway the Cons in The Tower

reviewText: Ugh.  TERRIBLE.  Good concept, poorly executed.  You have to make your way through utter darkness with sound as your only clue to guide you.  Unfortunately, you don't even get the sound of your own footsteps to reassure you that you're actually moving and not just continuously walking into a wall.  When the game is trying to instruct you on what to do, it's all in text and you can't do anything during it, just sit and wait.  Then, there are times when the narrator is talking and you can't move on until they've done their whole spiel, even though it only took your about 5 seconds to get to the next area.  Also, there was this long combat sequence about 5 minutes in, also in complete blackness, where you do nothing except occasionally hit a key on the keyboard when requested.  To top it all off, the menu is only accessible at specific points, which means I had to force quit out of this stupid game when I got sick of it.  I'm SO glad I didn't actually spend money on this game.  Quit after 15 minutes.

reviewText:
It's a lot better than when I was first bought it, but I still ran into a game breaking bug.


First you have to sit through a 4 minute long intro, which albeit has good voice work, doesn't tell you much of anything. (Basically: You're a family of traitors...Maaaybe)  Once that happens you'll be stopped from proceeding many times so your character can unnecessary describe what he just did in a poetically long way. It feels like the game wants you to watch it instead of play it.

Then we get to the techinal problems with the game:
1. The game is too dark. I have my monitor's brightness up all the way and I still had to install a 3rd party software to increase the brightness further to get past the first bit of pure blackness. (And I still couldn't see anything but the cieling.)

2. You have to crouch under so many things that barely graze your head. (The crouch button is C by the way, the game doesn't tell you.)

3. Frequently when you get to a manual save point you can't actually move the cursor to save the game. Alt-tabbing in and out can fix the problem sometimes, but if it doesn't... expect to watch the long intro again.

4. The game isn't optimized well, I had trouble getting the game to stay at 30fps. When you can't see anything due to the darkness, there is no excuse for this.


I can sympathize with the devlopers because they ran out of money while making it, but it still no excuse to sell this.

One of the worst games I have ever played.

The main character won't shut up and keep talking and talking. That completely kills the feeling of terror and immersion horror games usually give. And.... no subtitles! The store page says it has subtitles. I couldn't find it anywhere.

The gameplay is not good especially the level design. I ran into so many invisible walls and had to stop playing completely when I couldn't proceed to anywhere else because of an invisible wall. The controls are mediocre at best.

Just don't buy. Utter garbage.
